relation: Great for these types of students
I feel very safe, I am never worried about my safety.
The PE complex offers alot of fun stuff to do, such as rock climbing. The music/drama department also holds concerts and plays.
There is a subway in the cafeteria that is very popular. There are good sandwhiches sold by the cafeteria, but can be very expensive.
The teachers are great, especially the music teachers.
If youre looking for a party school this is not the school for you.

It is a quiet school, making it easy for students to focus. It great for students who are just starting college, as well as those who are going back to college. It is no where near a party school, it is very good for focused students.
pageTitle: Northeastern Illinois University (NEIU) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {111558=The campus has a very safe feel about it. Once, I was leaving the library at about 8 o'clock at night after a serious study session and I expected to be freaked out when going outside after dark, but the campus felt really safe. The lights made everything brighter and feel ok. We also have these pillars scattered around the campus that have a button in the middle. If there's ever an emergency, you would press the button and help would arrive soon., 124174=i go on the November 1 and 2nd when they have the dia de os muertos event atte school., 254461=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 221040=Activity hour (when most clubs/activities/Greek life meet) is on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 3:05 - 4:05 pm.}

textAfterTable: In three sentences Northeastern has a very comfortable environment. Teachers that you don't even have will ask you about your day and classes, they'll even offer any help that you would need. As well with the students, everyone is very talkative and welcoming. Login to rate or flag the reviews Antonio from Skokie, IL 02/24/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 2 of 63 Categories Comments Bang for the buck NEIU has a reputation for providing affordable education for many years now. The school is one of the cheapest forms of higher education in the Chicago land area. Recently it was ranked amongst the highest schools with the less amount of graduates leaving without debt. Am enjoying being here Student life at NEIU is complicated as the school is a commuter school. Needless to say many friendly people attended this university and there’s always something to get involved in.
